formattedAddress: 23 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
adrFormatAddress: 23 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA

editorialSummary.text: Refined Pan-Latin plates are the draw at this stylish, rustic-chic eatery with communal tables.

originalText.text: Loved our meal and the whole ambiance! Our family shared the pork taco platter, guacamole, churro donuts and crème brûlée. Food was unique, carefully prepared with excellent flavor. High quality food. Love the vibe and decor. Very comfortable to enjoy your time. Hip but not uncomfortably trendy. Server was so sweet.

text.text: Loved our meal and the whole ambiance! Our family shared the pork taco platter, guacamole, churro donuts and crème brûlée. Food was unique, carefully prepared with excellent flavor. High quality food. Love the vibe and decor. Very comfortable to enjoy your time. Hip but not uncomfortably trendy. Server was so sweet.

originalText.text: Popped in for a last minute bite here and it was excellent. Lamb sliders were delicious. Rainbow carrots were tasty & prepared in a totally unique way that I enjoyed. And the taco kit with carnitas was excellent as well (although 6 tortillas would be better than 5 if it’s “for two”) also had a great glass of wine to top it off. I’m looking forward to coming back and doing a full dinner with friends here. I’m a fan of their sister restaurant in Brooklyn & Comodo didn’t let me down. I will be back.

text.text: Popped in for a last minute bite here and it was excellent. Lamb sliders were delicious. Rainbow carrots were tasty & prepared in a totally unique way that I enjoyed. And the taco kit with carnitas was excellent as well (although 6 tortillas would be better than 5 if it’s “for two”) also had a great glass of wine to top it off. I’m looking forward to coming back and doing a full dinner with friends here. I’m a fan of their sister restaurant in Brooklyn & Comodo didn’t let me down. I will be back.

originalText.text:
The food was great overall but my main dish the picanha was disapppointing for $38 I was expecting it to be flavourful as most picanha are but it was just a regular steak cut up. You can tell the difference in the cut as you can barely see the fat cap as it was over trimmed. I would give this a 4.2 as I would definitely would not order this again even if it was $10 for the cut and taste. We went to New York Pao De Queijo the day before and their Picanha was 8.2/10 and definitely would have paid $38 for their picanha and they only charge $21. We did bring it up to them about it but it seems to be normal (we told them vs. them asking us how our meals were)

The bone marrow was good altbough I would choose a thinner bread, pao de Queijo was pricy but the cheese sauce was great that went with it. The cauliflower was good

For service it was ok as there was some hiccups at the end.
1. Service dropped in quality after the mains were served
2. We waited about 10-15mins after we finish but we didn't get service so I had to go to the bar to ask for the bill as they were busy chatting and eating
3. They charged us a drink that they didn't bring which was easily fixed to have them remove it
4. They didn't warn us about the kitchen closing so dessert was off the menu (or at least the waiter didn't ask the kitchen since they were making meals for them to eat)

originalText.text: Stopped in for a late solo dinner after a day of travel. The sausage and peppers pasta was amazing!!! The noodles were cooked perfectly al dente, and the flavor of the sauce was just the right amount of rich. Great atmosphere, nice music, cool details to admire throughout the restaurant.

text.text: Stopped in for a late solo dinner after a day of travel. The sausage and peppers pasta was amazing!!! The noodles were cooked perfectly al dente, and the flavor of the sauce was just the right amount of rich. Great atmosphere, nice music, cool details to admire throughout the restaurant.

originalText.text: Actually pleasantly surprised. I met my new wife here after a day in Hudson. She had my drink waiting for me as she usually does. We stayed at Freehand and were pretty tired from the previous two days. It worked out swimmingly. We had the Branzino for two and it was perfect.
